:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10279752275/job/28445704302)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10279752275/job/28445703886)
I don't understand why this change is needed: these are variables that can only be imported if they're mentioned in the type, right?
Yes, it's not strictly necessary. I found it less confusing having these closer to the point of us.

```suggestion
variable {M' : Type*} [AddCommGroup M'] [Module R M'] {N'} [AddCommGroup N'] [Module S N']
```
Otherwise, I fear it is interpreted as `Type _`, which can (seldom, but still) cause some weird things.
